alert.note: Alert for Ellsworth; McPherson; Rice; Saline (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 9:19PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western McPherson, northeastern Rice, southeastern Ellsworth and Saline Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 919 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles north of Brookville to near Marquette to near Little River. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Salina, Mcpherson, Lindsborg, Marquette, Little River, Assaria, Brookville, Smolan, Windom, Falun, Glendale, Salina Airport, Mcpherson Airport, Bridgeport, Kanopolis Lake and Kanopolis State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 57 and 95. Interstate 70 between Mile Markers 236 and 258. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central Kansas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for central Kansas.
